articles.description: England winger Bukayo Saka commits his future to Premier League leaders Arsenal by signing a new five-year deal.
articles.title: Bukayo Saka signs new five-year deal at Arsenal

articles.description: Henry Pollock is handed his first Test start as Steve Borthwick makes three changes to his starting XV for England's Six Nations match against Ireland on Saturday.
articles.title: England team v Ireland:  Henry Pollock gets first start

articles.description: Ireland and Australia are both eliminated from the T20 World Cup as rain forced the cancellation of the Group B game between the Irish and Zimbabwe.
articles.title: T20 World Cup: Relentless rain ends Ireland and Australia's hopes

articles.description: One set of clubs dominate the Champions League, another win their domestic title every year but cannot compete - does European football have a problem?
articles.title: 'We really messed up' - does European football need more balance?
Winter Olympics: Men's curling and nordic combined - watch & follow

articles.description: Former UFC champion Ronda Rousey will fight Gina Carano in May - a decade after she retired from MMA.
articles.title: MMA: Ronda Rousey to come out of retirement to fight Gina Carano

articles.description: Elana Meyers Taylor made history by winning monobob gold to become the oldest individual athlete to become Winter Olympic champion, all while empowering mothers and female athletes.
articles.title: Elana Meyers Taylor makes Winter Olympic history as oldest gold medal winner

articles.description: England captain Leah Williamson returns to the squad as they prepare to begin their 2027 Women's World Cup qualifying campaign.
articles.title: England captain Leah Williamson returns for World Cup qualifiers

articles.description: Tyson Fury makes his return on 11 April and believes his inactivity could play a big role in his comeback.
articles.title: Tyson Fury: Heavyweight will have no coach or nutritionist for comeback fight against Makhmudov

articles.description: New Tottenham Hotspur interim manager Igor Tudor says "nobody can accept" the club's current position.
articles.title: Tottenham: Igor Tudor says it is 'no time for excuses' as he looks to address 'unacceptable' form
